Title.evidence: Efficacy of Antibiotic-Impregnated Shunt Catheters in Reducing Bacterial Infections: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Participants.evidence: The study included patients of all ages and etiologies of shunt implantation.

Intervention.evidence: Interventions being AISC and comparators being standard shunts.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of antibiotic-impregnated shunt catheters (AISC) in reducing bacterial shunt infections in patients with hydrocephalus.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of bacterial infections, and the secondary outcome was shunt failure.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis included both intention-to-treat and per-protocol approaches, but specific numbers for each group were not provided.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The use of AISC was significantly associated with a reduction in infections (OR = 0.42; 95% CI: 0.33-0.54).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration: PROSPERO registration number not provided.
